diagnosis.final_diagnosis: Anaplastic oligodendroglioma with allelic loss of chromosomes 1p and 19q
diagnosis.diagnostic_reasoning: The patient's presentation included seizures and a nonenhancing right frontal-lobe lesion with mass effect. MRI and metabolic studies suggested a primary brain tumor, with the differential diagnosis including low-grade astrocytic tumors and oligodendrogliomas. Further analysis of tumor tissue revealed histologic features consistent with anaplastic oligodendroglioma, and genetic testing indicated loss of 1p and 19q.
